result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John J Gfesser

records.addlTxt: Order for Examination underr 971.16 Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 9/19/22.
Review hearing on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:04 PM Defendant John J Gfesser in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for John J Gfesser.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case was set for plea and sentencing, but Atty Kershek wishes to change course.

In cases 22CM454, 22CM455, and 22CM1103:
Defense moves to enter a special plea of NGI and requests an NGI Evaluation under 971.16 be ordered.  Court Grants and order an NGI Evaluation under 971.16.  Court will Appoint Behavioral Consultants.   Evaluation to be filed by 11/23/22.

Case 22CM1305 tagsalong. 
Defendant will provide updated cell phone number to the court.
Review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

3:15 PM Defendant John J Gfesser in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for John J Gfesser.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for plea and sentencing. State has complied with victim's rights. 
State reads offer into the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.
Court goes off the record for a few minutes to allow the Defense to review the complaint prior to completion of colloquy. 
Court discontinues the plea colloquy to allow for the Defendant to stabilize on new medications.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
State's Offer as Presented by Defense
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

1:32 PM Defendant John J Gfesser in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for John J Gfesser. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases were set for plea and sentencing, however Defense has received a new offer to discuss with Defendant. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date as soon as possible.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
